msDesc.head: Book of Hours, Use of Sarum; Flanders (?Bruges), 15th century, second quarter

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Sarum

msItem.note: For added texts on pastedown and fols. 2r-3v see below, 'Added texts'. Laudian (?) table on contents on fol. 3v.

msItem.title: Fifteen O’s
msItem.incipit: O domine Iesus Christe eterna dulcedo te amancium iubilus excedens
msItem.explicit: te merear laudare cum omnibus sanctis tuis in eternum. Amen.
msItem.note: Ps.-Bridget of Sweden; pr. Revelationes selectae S. Birgittae, ed. A. Heuser (1851), 3442-51. Fol. 4r was originally blank (fol. 4v is a miniature); text was added in England in the later 15th or the 16th century to supply the loss of the first 'O' on the folio originally preceding fol. 5.
Fol. 9v originally blank, for added prayer see below, 'Added texts'.
Suffrages; fols. 10, 14, 16, 18, 21 are inserted miniatures, blank on the recto.
St Thomas of Canterbury (Chevalier 26999)
msItem.incipit: Gaude lux Londaniarum Thoma tutor animarum

msItem.note: St George (cf. Chevalier 7242)
msItem.incipit: Georgi martir inclite te decet laus et gloria

msItem.note: St Mary Magdalen (Chevalier 6895)
msItem.incipit: Gaude pia Magdalena spes salutis uite uena

msItem.note: St Margaret (Chevalier 7011)
msItem.incipit: Gaude uirgo Margareta que nutricis gregem leta

msItem.note: St John the Baptist (Chevalier 26988)
msItem.incipit: Gaude Iohannis baptista qui in uentris clausus cista

msItem.note: St Christopher
msItem.incipit: Sancte Christofore martir Iesu Christi qui pro eius nomine penas pertulisti
msItem.note: AH 46 no. 207 (Chevalier 18445) followed by note on those looking at Christopher's image and a prayer to Christopher.
St Katherine (Chevalier 6991)
msItem.incipit: Gaude uirgo Katherina qua doctores lex diuina

msItem.note: St Barbara (Chevalier 6714)
msItem.incipit: Gaude Barbara regina summa pollens in doctrina

msItem.title: Office of the Virgin ‘secundum consuetudinem Anglie’ with the Hours of the Cross worked in.
msItem.note: Fols. 23, 30, 41, 45, 48, 55 are inserted miniatures, the rectos blank except for added text on fol. 29v-30r, for which see below, 'Added texts'.

fol. 31r, Lauds, with suffrages of the Holy Spirit, Trinity, Holy Cross, St Michael, St John the Baptist, SS Peter and Paul, St Andrew, St Stephen, St Lawrence, St Thomas, St Nicholas, St Mary Magdalen, St Katherine, St Margaret, All Saints, Peace.
fol. 42r, Prime
fol. 46r, Terce
fol. 49r, Sext
Fol. 51r, Nones
Fol. 53r, Vespers
Compline followed (fol. 58v) by Salve regina and collect
For added texts on fol. 59v see below, 'Added texts'.

msItem.title: Paraphrase of the Salve regina (Chevalier 18318)
msItem.incipit: Salue uirgo uirginum stella matutina
Ave mundi spes Maria
msItem.note: Chevalier 1974, Walther 1945, followed by versicle and prayer

msItem.title: Seven Joys of the Virgin (Chevalier 21899) with indulgence of 100 days from Pope Clement
msItem.incipit: Virgo templum trinitatis
msItem.note: Fol. 71v blank.

msItem.title: Devotion of the Five Wounds
msItem.incipit: Omnibus consideratis paradysus uoluptatis es Ihesu piissime
msItem.note: John of Limoges, De passione domini: (Chevalier 14081, Walther 13294, AH 31 no. 68. Followed (fol. 74r) by prayer 'Omnipotens sempiterne deus qui unigenitum filium tuum ...'. Fol. 74v blank.

msItem.title: Devotion of the Seven Words with rubric
msItem.incipit: Domine Ihesu Christi qui septem uerba in die ultimo uite tue in cruce pendens dixisti
msItem.note: Ps.-Bede, De septem verbis, PL 94.561-2.

msItem.title: Prayers to Christ (cf. Leroquais, Heures, I. 111 and Horae Eboracenses p. 177)
msItem.incipit: Precor te piissime domine Ihesu Christi propter illam caritatem qua tu rex celestis pendebas in cruce
Deus qui voluisti pro redempcione mundi a Iudeis reprobari

msItem.title: Prayers for mass
msItem.note: 'Ave domine J.C. uerbum patris filius uirginis agnus dei', 'Ave principium nostre creacionis', cf. Chevalier 2059 (here presented as including 'Ave verum corpus natum', Chevalier 2175), 'Ave caro Christi cara', Chevalier 1710), 'Anima Christi sanctifica me' (Chevalier 1090), 'Domine J.C. qui hanc sacratissimam carnem', with rubric of indulgence of Pope Boniface for 2000 years
Fol. 79v blank.

msItem.title: Penitential Psalms
msItem.note: Fol. 80 is an inserted miniature, the recto blank.

msItem.title: Litany (including 'eswarde', fol. 90r, 'wallepaxte' and 'zwichine', fol. 90v) followed by 12 collects
Office of the dead
msItem.note: Fol. 96 is an inserted miniature, the recto blank.

msItem.title: Commendation of souls
msItem.note: Fol. 125v blank.

msItem.title: Psalms of the passion
msItem.note: Fol. 126 is an inserted miniature, recto blank.

msItem.title: Psalter of St Jerome
msItem.note: Rubric ('Beatus vero Iheronimus in hoc modo psalterium istud disposuit ...') and introductory prayer ('Suscipere dignes domine deus omnipotens hos psalmos consecratos quos ego indignus decantare cupio ...'), fol. 131r-v. Fol. 132 is an inserted miniature, the recto blank. For early additions on fols. 142v-143v see below.
Added texts:
Added texts on paper endleaves from the mid-16th century binding, two hands (item (a) and items (b)-(e), possibly Augustine Steward, see Provenance).

msItem.incipit: God be in my hed and in my understondyng
msItem.note: 'A prayer of St Richard of Chichester', DIMEV 1549 (this copy not listed), here 5 lines (as in STC 15917).

msItem.incipit: O all myghty & most mercyfull father we haue erryd and strayd
msItem.explicit: lyve a godly ryghtuys & sobyr lyfe to the glory of thy holy name. Amen.
msItem.note: The general confession from the Book of Common Prayer of 1552 and later

msItem.incipit: O the depnesse of the habundant wisdom & knolage of god
msItem.explicit: & for hym are all thynges to hym by glory for evyr & evyr. Amen.
msItem.note: Romans 11:33-6 in William Tyndale's translation

msItem.incipit: Adam disobedyens dammyd vs all
msItem.explicit: ere we owyr selffes wrowt good
msItem.note: The marginal note on Romans 5.15 in Tyndale's 1534 New Testament. Fol. 2v blank.

msItem.incipit: O lord god thow arte Ryghtuous and all thy Iugymentes ar trew
msItem.note: Similar to the version in the Matthew Bible.
Originally blank, prayer added sixteenth century (same hand as item i(a)?):
msItem.incipit: O here vs most mercyfull makar
msItem.note: Couplets; not in DIMEV.

msItem.rubric: The preyere of Manascht kyng of Iuda
msItem.incipit: O lord all myghty god of our fathers
msItem.explicit: to the belongythe glori wald without ȝend. Amen.
msItem.note: Same hand as item i(b)-(e) above.
Two added texts (the first Chevalier 7017), late 15th century or 16th century:
msItem.incipit: Gaude virgo mater Christi que per aurem concepisti Gabriele nuncio. Guade quia deo plena
Deus qui beatissimam virginem Mariam in conceptu et partu virginitate seruata duplici gaudio letificasti

msItem.note: Seven Joys of the Virgin (Chevalier 6810); added in England probably in the second half of the fifteenth century.
msItem.incipit:
Gaude flore virginali
Honoreque speciali

msItem.note: Responsory for St Andrew (cf. Cantus index 006451c) added around the same time as (v)
msItem.incipit: Vir iste in populo suo mitissimus apparuit

supportDesc.foliation: 2-143 in 19th century pencil, the last endleaf unfoliated.
supportDesc.collation: 1(6-1+1) (fols. 4-9: first original leaf wanting before fol. 5, miniature inserted (misbound) before fol. 5), 2 (thirteen) (fols. 10-22: fols. 10, 14, 16, 18, 21 are inserted miniatures), 3(8+2) (fols. 23-32: inserted miniatures before 1 (fol. 23) and after 6 (fol. 30)), 4(8+1) (fols. 33-41: miniature inserted after 8 (fol. 41)); 5(8+2) (fols. 42-51: miniatures inserted after 3 (fol. 45) and after 5 (fol. 48)), 6(8+1?) (fols. 52-60: miniature inserted after 3 (fol. 55)), 7(8) (fols. 61-8), 8(8) (fols. 69-76), 9(four) (fols. 77-80, fol. 80 is an inserted miniature), 10(8) (fols. 81-8), 11(8+1) (fols. 89-97, miniature inserted after 7 (fol. 96), 12(8) (fols. 98-105), 13(8) (fols. 106-113), 14(8) (fols. 114-121), 15(8+1) (fols. 122-130, miniature inserted after 4 (fol. 126)), 16(8+1) (fols. 131-139, miniature inserted after 1 (fol. 132)), 17(4) (fols. 140-3)

layoutDesc.layout: 20 long lines; ruled space 103 70 . Ruling in mauve crayon, main framing lines the full width and height of the page, double horizontal lines at top and bottom of the text area.

decoDesc.summary: Good miniatures, borders, initials. (Pächt and Alexander i. 315, pl. XXV)
decoDesc.decoNote:
Miniatures on inserted leaves in the style of the 'Gold Scrolls Group'. Miniatures for St George, St Mary Magdalen, Nones, Vespers presumably missing, miniatures perhaps also missing before fols. 60 and 115.
(fol. 4v) St John the Baptist (misplaced)
(fol. 10v) Murder of St Thomas of Canterbury (suffrage)
(fol. 14v) St Margaret (suffrage)
(fol. 16v) St Katherine with Maxentius (suffrage, misplaced)
(fol. 18v) St Christopher (suffrage)
(fol. 21v) St Barbara (suffrage)
(fol. 23v) Annunciation (Matins)
(fol. 30v) Betrayal (Lauds)
(fol. 41v) Christ before Pilate (Prime)
(fol. 45v) Flagellation (Terce)
(fol. 48v) Carrying the Cross (Sext)
(fol. 55v) Entombment (Compline)
(fol. 83v) Last Judgement (Penitential psalms)
(fol. 96v) Funeral service (Office of the Dead)
(fol. 127v) Christ as the Man of Sorrows (Psalms of the Passion)
(fol. 132v) St Jerome in his Study (Psalter of St Jerome)

Full borders of ivy leaf and luxuriant acanthus, with occasional human figures or grotesques (e.g. fols. 60r, 81r, 96v-7r, 115r) across each opening with a miniature, also on fols. 12r, 13r, 20r, 51r, 53r, 51r, 60r where the corresponding miniatures are missing or misbound; half-borders (centre of top and bottom margins) on fols. 64r, 69r, 72r, 75r.
Typically 6-line decorated initials with gold at the beginning of major sections, 2-line at minor sections.
Flourished initials at the beginning of verses, dark blue flourished in red or gold flourished in light blue.
Space left for 1- and 2-line initials on fols. 142v-143v, not filled in.

binding.p: Mid-16th century blind-stamped binding by L. W. of Norwich; Oldham rolls 698 and 612. Rebacked.

physDesc.accMat: Fragments of an unidentified thirteenth-century English manuscript are in the binding.

history.provenance: Executed in Flanders for the English market as suggested by the script, decoration, and spellings in the litany; in England by the late fifteenth century as indicated by the additions on fols. 142v-143v. Suffrage for Thomas of Canterbury and miniature not defaced.
16th-century Norwich binding. Pertinet Augustini Styward ald' Norwici Maiori. anno 1556., back pastedown; Augustine Steward, 1491-1571 of Norwich, on whom see History of Parliament.
history.acquisition: Part of his first donation to the Bodleian, 1635.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford, March 2022. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 177 Quarto Catalogue, p. 551 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 34

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: S. J. P. van Dijk, Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, vol. 4: Books of Hours (typescript, 1957), p. 184

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for publication on Digital Bodleian.
